column5: ....Oh I see, another one of those guys with two boats.
well I sold my nitro bass boat  but, I do have the folding boat too
WTG Terry, purty fish !!
You can tell that the waves are an issue even before the video starts.  Great report!
Sure I could Chris....you just many not like the price of the prop !
Nice fish and man thats one mother of a trolling motor.  Nice work guys.
so there really are fish out there  Nice job guys .  TB
Nice work fellas.  I hate bad weather. lol.
NICE!! I hope you guys rubbed slime all over the boat so it can attract more 'skis!! That's service by the way, buy a trolling motor and have it installed for no extra charge.
nice report!  Cheers!
If i buy something from you, i can reel in a musky?  WTG that is great.  Keep at it Wayne.
Nice fish Terry!!
Glen...you had the right colour idea last Monday. Matched the colour of what Terry was using...
Congrats guys. Great looking fish and a good day on the water.

Wow...I'm gonna buy all my stuff from you so you can install it...LOL.  If I show up with stuff does that count too?  Looked pretty rough and chilly out there....snow did you say?  I thought you couldn't swear on this board!!!  Nice muskie....will read the report.

Up early this morning to see the sun come up. Wasn't "Lew O'clock" or anything...but it was 7:30.    Was waiting for this ugly bugger to show up...so we could install the motorquide wireless he was buying off me. Full service sale...how many used items have you ever bought that included installation? LOL I made Terry do the grunt work...I just drilled the holes and prepped the bolts for length.       We got that all done about 10 and headed down to the boat launch with my Lund and set out in search of Esox.     Looked like it was going to clear up...and no sooner did that thought cross our minds than it was snowing, sleeting, raining and the wind started up again.     These don't look that big in the pics...but we put them over my bow. Some were going 5 feet or so.    Terry checking his bait is clean..   Oh...and we did put a fish in the boat..I'll let Terry tell that one when he adds his pictures/video. Not too long...but chunky.     Cheers, Wayne
WTG guys. Looks pretty nipply out there. You got a good motor Terry. I would have taken that one. Good fishy too! Congrats!
better then we did Wayne he nothin beats being out on the water a good bud like terry. I got to spend it with Brian but I will let him post our report or lak of
Nice to see you guys hit a decent fish!

Well hey wayne,you were right the winds were down for a little while early this morning    but that soon came to an end...LOL..LOL.  As i can see by your pics in your report....oh well at least you and terry got out this morn,for a while....and that big LUND of yours will handle just about anything , so its no wonder you guys are the only boat out today.  .LOL..LOL  And what did you replace that motorguide wireless,with,they are top notch!!!!!!anyway nice project,and terry will leike the new toy for sure...cheers
The first 70" one in Canada !
nice fish
Beautiful looking fish!
He did all the installation work so it was nice of you to 'let' him catch a fish .  Great job guys.

I would like  to thank Wayne for installing the motor and for the day of fishing I had a great time.. did he say that it rained   snowed  hail  sleet and big waves too that boat really handles the big water well and I had to keep checking to see if the motor was running man you can't hear it  Wayne had a spot in mind that he thought we would have a good shot at getting a muskie   as we trolled near the spot he said it should get shallower about here...right on cue ...yup we were on the spot then he said now it would be perfect if one of the reels started to sing..... he barely got it out of his mouth and the clicker on my reel started singing away  reeled her in and got that muskie..  I did a small video to see if it would show the big waves but it didn't show up that well  <embed width="448" height="361" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" src="http://i25.photobucket.com/player.swf?file=http://vid25.photobucket.com/albums/c52/Mrbeee1954/DSCF3131.flv"></embed>   great way to spend a lazy sunday
Great Pics and Nice Fish!!  But I really think those waves are photoshoped  Corey
WOW  Whuda thunk it, a musky on Wayne's boat  Nice fish for sure, way to go Terry  Man those waves a nasty.  Cool video too.  Joey
Wayne's seems to be catching on to musky fishing  Good on Wayne and Terry for getting out
I really like the first pic Wayne the Pink sunrise oh and Terry lying down on the job.  I was in some pretty big waves yesterday.  Nice fish Terry.
LOL Phil..the biggest thing I think is confidence, and Mr. Thorpe instilled a LOT of that in the 4 days Dano and I spent with him.
confidence definetly a must to have for all species good on ya for finally getting that boat slimey there Wayne
Nice fish! WTG and may you have many more with the new motor
Nice fish guys.  What lure and how fast were you trolling ?
Want the coords too John? LOL  4.8 MPH and a natural coloured bait.
Nice deal you got there Terry....great new toy, full installation and a nice fish!  Nice report Wayne.....starting to look like you are a prety good guide...lakers and now Musky!

Yes please.  I was down there when I picked up my motorguide at backwater last year for the first time, looked like a real nice area. I was looking at some of Brians fat muskies, some biggins out there. I asked him for his gps cords but he wasn't interested (jk).

....Why is it that photos never really seem to do wave hieghts justice? Though you can definitely tell in the video clip that the bow of that big Lund is bouncing quite a bit. Good job on the musky, I'm sure it'll only be a matter of time before you find yourself connected to a leviathan.  Now what boat have you installed that Motorguide on Terry?  And Wayne being the generous guy that you are, if I was to buy a prop off you would you be able to install a boat and motor on it.
Well done guys, nice to break the boats GB muskie cherry!
the trolling motor went on my 16 ft sylan
